etymology.description: 幸(幸) (xìng, "fortunate; lucky") + 福(福) (fú, "blessing; good fortune") = being fortunate and blessed, which leads to happiness.
etymology.interpretation: The combination of being fortunate 幸(幸) (xìng) and having good fortune 福(福) (fú) perfectly captures the idea of happiness and feeling blessed. It suggests a state where favorable conditions and blessings lead to one feeling truly content and lucky.

examples.chinese: 我追求幸福(我追求幸福)。
家庭团聚带来幸福(家庭團聚帶來幸福)，满心喜悦溢于言表(滿心喜悅溢於言表)。
examples.pinyin: Jiātíng tuánjù dàilái xìngfú, mǎnxīn xǐyuè yì yú yánbiǎo.
examples.english: Family reunions bring happiness, and the joy is evident.
